item.title: International Partnerships for Student Learning at Harvard

item.title: Social and Emotional Learning Programs in Implementation
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I’m Lauren.

I started my career as a public school teacher in NYC with Teach for America because I wanted to change the trajectory of kid’s lives. It turns out I ended up changing the trajectory of my own.

Since then, I’ve been involved in the tech and education sector spanning the Ministry of Education of Spain, digital education strategy at Coursera, instructional design at Facebook and product management at Waking Up. 

While at Harvard pursuing a Master's degree, I was influenced by Seymour Papert's "MindStorms," which teaches us that coding is not only a tool to build, but a way to train our minds to think differently. It empowered me to learn coding, and I have since become a full-stack engineer.

I'm hard-working, curiosity-driven, and thrive in collaborative, positive team environments. I'm especially interested in education, climate, data visualization, entrepreneurship, and mission-driven organizations.

Let's connect! Lauren.Swersky@gmail.com

item.title: Etsy Sales Map
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
I designed and programmed a custom interactive map to visualize my company's sales data from the past 10 months.

👉 Check out the live version here

Tech stack: React, Google Maps API, JavaScript, MUI, HTML/CSS, Papa Parse.

item.title: Technology and Constructionism
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky

item.title: Women in Leadership Speech
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded: During my teaching fellowship with the Harvard Center for Asia Leadership Initiatives, I gave TED-style speeches to groups of 50–300 students and young professionals about women in leadership. In my speech I encouraged women to stand up for and believe in themselves, and I exhorted men to support the women in their lives. Echoing Joe Biden's platform, I believe every issue is a women’s issue — health care, the economy, education, national security. I believe we need an aggressive and comprehensive plan to further women’s economic and physical security and ensure full inclusion of and equality for women. Below are the slides from the speech. Click on images to enlarge.

item.title: UNICEF
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
They say it doesn't feel like work when you're doing something you believe in. That's why I enjoyed working in partnership with UNICEF to advise on China's innovative K-12 education program on social and emotional learning (SEL). More about the project:
  • Social and Emotional Learning Programs: A literature review on social and emotional learning curricula and programs.
  • P.A.T.H.S to Adulthood- A Case Study: A case study of Hong Kong's P.A.T.H.S SEL program that attempts to develop "21st century skills" using Pellegrino and Hilton's framework. Included is a proposal on how to effectively evaluate the program.
  • Transferring Project P.A.T.H.S. to Mainland China- Small Adjustments, Large Gains: An exploration of the relevancy and feasibility of transferring SEL programs to mainland China as aligned with UNICEF's education strategy.
  • UNICEF vs. World Bank: A synthesis of the comparative education strategies of UNICEF and the World Bank.

item.title: Advising Harvard's Education Strategy
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded: I researched the use of partnerships and networks in Harvard University's global education strategy. Based on qualitative research findings, I developed recommendations for improving the use of partnerships and their leadership implications. I conducted qualitative research to understand the role of partnerships and networks in Harvard University's global education strategy. I used the results to develop recommendations for improving the use of partnerships and their leadership implications. More detail: International Partnerships for Student Learning at Harvard. Presentation slides below.

item.title: Teach for America
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
I joined Teach for America because I wanted to change the trajectory of kids' lives. I ended up changing the trajectory of my own. As a Teach for America corps member in Washington Heights, New York City, I not only learned a lot about effective teaching, but I also learned how to adapt to unforeseen challenges, think creatively to solve tough problems, and lead a diverse group towards a common goal. Many of the challenges I encountered—grossly oversized classrooms, behind grade-level students, language barriers—required patience, resourcefulness, grit, investing others in my goals, and collaboration. Seeing the success of my students firsthand reaffirmed my belief that the achievement gap is a solvable problem, and I am just as committed, now as I was on day one, to make sure this becomes a reality. I put a significant amount of effort and care into creating lesson plans and curricula tailored to meet my students' needs. You can find a sample of my work here:
  • Class Goals and Standards
  • Lesson Plan Sample - ELA
  • Lesson Plan Sample - Writing

item.title: TESOL Certification
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded: Thanks to an established partnership between Lehman college and TFA, I pursued my Masters in TESOL while teaching full time. During this program, I explored fundamentals in curriculum design, language acquisition, teaching, and learning. My thesis was about Communicative Competencies.

item.title: Inspiration & Self-Creation
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
Here are some books, people, and ideas that make me tick.

                                 

"Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life: The longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind." -Bertrand Russell

                                                                  

                  

"The role of the teacher is to create the conditions for invention rather than provide ready-made knowledge" -Seymour Papert

                                                           

"A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes." - Hugh Downs

item.title: Resume
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky

item.title: Co-founding NomNom Foods
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded: While at Harvard I co-founded NomNom Foods, a nonprofit with a mission to provide healthy, high-quality meals to students in America’s public schools. We were semifinalists at Harvard's Education Innovation Competition.

item.title: Blended Learning Models: Confronting the Skepticism
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.excerpt:encoded: A blog post in response to the The Atlantic article titled, "When Computers Are Co-Teachers." Written for Clayton Christensen Institute for Disruptive Innovation.

item.title: Music
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
I'm a musician! I play guitar and DJ.

For me, music is a portal into the soul. It is a beautiful combination of science and art; logic and creativity; love and hope.

You can find my music on my SoundCloud, including my most recent performance at Facebook's Inside Lands Music Festival.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I'm Lauren.

I started my career as a public school teacher in NYC with Teach for America because I wanted to change the trajectory of kid’s lives. It turns out I ended up changing the trajectory of my own.

Since then, I’ve been involved in the tech and education sector spanning the Ministry of Education of Spain, digital education strategy at Coursera, instructional design at Facebook and product management at Waking Up. 

I received a Master's at Harvard to learn about creating scalable quality educational experiences. While at Harvard, I was influenced by Seymort Paper's Paper "MindStorms," which teaches us that coding is not only a tool to build, but a way to train our minds to think differently. It empowered me to learn coding, and I have since become a full-stack engineer.

I'm hard-working, curiosity-driven, and thrive in collaborative, positive team environments. I'm especially interested in education, climate, data visualization, entrepreneurship, and mission-driven organizations.

Let's connect! Lauren.Swersky@gmail.com

item.title: Facebook
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
At Facebook, I wore many hats:

  • I supported businesses with their ad operations and marketing campaigns.
  • I created scalable educational programs and products to teach advertisers how to grow their businesses on Facebook.
  • I worked with the CDC on our COVID-19 initiative to help spread accurate, up-to-date information.
  • I worked with product leaders and group admins to help translate online action to offline engagement.

Sample work

  • Marketing Science Study Guide: I created this CMS-based study guide to prepare marketing specialists and media analysts for the marketing science certification exam.
  • Marketing eLearning Courses: I created these eLearning courses to teach media buyers, planners and analysts how to use Facebook’s measurement solutions to reach their business goals. Sample topics: Conversion Lift Tests, Analyzing Reports, Facebook Pixel.

item.title: Coursera
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
Coursera envisions a world in which anyone, anywhere can transform their life by accessing the world's best learning experience.

At Coursera, I:

  • managed the beta testing process to ensure high-quality product launch
  • advised ~100 universities on their education offerings, curriculum design and learning strategy
  • created content for Coursera for Refugees, a portal designed for ~30,000 refugee learners. I presented the work at the EMOOCS 2017 conference in Madrid.
  • launched Coursera for Brazil
  • reviewed learner analytics and conducted usability testing
  • trained professors how to create pedagogically-sound online courses

https://www.coursera.org/refugees

item.title: Babeloo Designs
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
In September 2022, I launched a Babeloo Designs. Inspired my experiences on the Camino de Santiago and living in Italy, I designed and developed a product line of 28 SKUs from concept to production, infusing them with elements that represent global cultures.

To bolster our market presence, I partnered with a top-rated NYC shop, taking the brand into the B2B wholesale arena. Overseeing product development and sourcing, I collaborated directly with Italian and Chinese suppliers. My role involved handling a range of logistical and operational challenges, including quality control, international freight, and inventory management. This consistent effort led to an acknowledgment on Etsy where I was named the Star Seller for three consecutive months, and one of our products achieved bestseller status.

item.title: Waking Up's First Retreat
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded: As a Product Manager at Waking Up, I owned the development and launch of our first-ever meditation retreat. The retreat that reached 25k people across 159 countries. I worked with product designers, engineers, marketing, and data analytics from conceptualization to deployment.

item.title: Custom Styles

item.title: Ask George Carlin: A 21st Century Bot
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
Welcome! This project leverages the power of OpenAI API to bring to life a conversational AI bot modeled after the iconic stand-up comedian, George Carlin.

I created an asynchronous server-side function using Node.js to interact with OpenAI's GPT-3 API. My function takes user input and crafts a custom prompt to instruct the GPT-3 model to emulate comedian George Carlin's unique style and humor. I've also implemented error handling and input validation, ensuring that the final generated text is sent back as a JSON response.

Ask George a question at the live link 👉 here

item.title: An Interactive Celebration
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
Introducing My Brother

Utilizing the power of Typed.js and Particles.js, this application serves as a dynamic tribute to my brother Daniel Swersky. It showcases his talents, the various roles he plays in life, and how he has a knack for building meaningful relationships with the people around him.

Live link: Explore and Have Fun! (It's fun, trust me!)

item.title: CompostNYC
item.dc:creator: laurenswersky
item.content:encoded:
A Proximity-Based 3D Visualization to Help New Yorkers Find Compost Bins 🗽🌱

Introduction

Welcome to an exciting new way to explore composting in New York City! I created CompostNYC to help NYers understand how far your building is from the nearest composting location. With the growing awareness of environmental sustainability, this tool aims to make composting more accessible for NYC residents.

The Build Process

Phase 1: Data Collection

  • Obtained composite site location data and NYC building data.

Data Sources:

  • NYC OpenData
  • BigQuery
  • PLUTO from CARTO data warehouse

Phase 2: Spatial Analyses

  • Goal: To determine which buildings are within various distances from the nearest compost bin.
  • Wrote SQL commands to identify buildings within specific distances (e.g., 83m equivalent to 1 block, 3 blocks, and 5 blocks).

Sample SQL Query:

SELECT
    b.* -- Select all columns from building_locations
FROM
    carto-demo-data.demo_tables.manhattan_pluto_data b,
    carto-dw-ac-zp3r15zi.shared.CompostNYC c
WHERE
    ST_DWithin(b.geom, c.geom, 400);

Phase 3: Adding a CARTO Layer

  • Visualized the data using the CARTO API for a rich, interactive user experience.

Phase 4: Rendering the 3D Map

  • Connected to Google Tiles API and rendered the photorealistic tiles on deck.gl for a 3D map visualization.

Phase 5: Styling the Map

  • After acquiring the necessary data via the CARTO API, we color-coded the buildings according to their proximity to compost bins.

Phase 6: Shipping the Product!

After rigorous phases of data collection, analysis, and visualization, we're thrilled to announce that CompostNYC is now live!

👉 Check it out: Live link here

Conclusion

CompostNYC is more than just a visualization; it's a tool aimed to encourage more sustainable living in New York City. By understanding the proximity of compost bins to residential and commercial buildings, we hope to inspire more people to compost and contribute to a cleaner, greener NYC.

If you have any questions, comments, or would like to collaborate, feel free to reach out to us. Happy composting, New Yorkers! 🌱🗽
